title: Top Lanes State
body:
I personally feel as though top lane is in a really odd unbalanced state right now.

I have been having reoccurring situations happening where I get a lead and then somehow I am behind and can't actually do anything(Just from the champions?)

Against a Darius he was late to lane so I hit level 2 first, I also managed to get a minion wave of about 8 minions in the middle of the lane. He started to run at me so I kited back while still trading hits with him so it was essentially him level 1 vs me level 2 and 8 minions. He won this and was still able to walk away from all the minions and be healthy.

Against a Trundle I scored an early kill and then like 2 minutes later he walked under tower (tanking the tower damage, my damage + my cc) killed me and was still close to full health.

I don't understand why these champions win out in what should be terrible situations.

replies.body: What champs were you playing in these scenarios?
ALL U HAVE TO DO IS PULL OUT THE LMAOKAI AND YOUR TOP LANE IS A BREEZE

I agree, being a teemo I can relate. I started laning really late because I had dced with bad internet and I had no TP. I got the most kills in that game and carried my team from 10 deaths down and 2 dragons down. It's just the unbalanced champions.
That's much broader and probably just comes down to a bunch of mistakes over a long term by your opponents
